bibl.title: Dispatch from L. de R. du Verge, Consul, to William Hunter, Acting General Secretary of State, December 1, 1882
Despatches from United States consuls in St. Paul de Loanda, 1854-1893

revisionDesc.change: Creation of individual xml file, transcription, encoding.

div1.dateline: United States Consulate St Paul de Loanda December 1, 1882.
div1.note: Hon: Hunter Act gn. Secretary of State Washington D.C.
div1.p: Sir, I have the honor to acknowledge the receipt of your 2 Circulars dated Sept. 5th and 13th 1882. In answer to your circular of Sept. 13thth. I would respectfully state that I have already brought the subject before the Civil and Military goals of Angola with the Lo lands, of St. Thome and Renciss included, offering them the lech of refined Pehatumm for City and military ecse, as mentioned to the state Dept. in my dispatch No. 6". That Kerosene act was in great demand here and all over this Coast. But the shippers and Masters of Am: Vessels should be very careful have they are deal with the white and blacks of this part of the country, Am: Commerce has almost been dueua by Am: shippers and martes ever fault as reported, as reported in my departed no of another important trade will soon be of farming implements of all kinds.
I have the honor to be Sir Your obedient servant
Stats for merit of comdr of the Enter
Consulate of the United States of America at St. Paul de Loauda 3. 90. C. Africa
L. de R. du Verge to State Department Washington D. C.
Incloses Reasons why Agents were appointed at Amlry Bongsrella g. particularly Mossamedes.
